test_cases.Title: Definitions_and_Abbreviations_001_App_TEST_Mobile

Steps.Step Description: Open the application and navigate to the Definitions and Abbreviations section.
Steps.Expected Result: The Definitions and Abbreviations section is displayed correctly.

Steps.Step Description: Verify that the abbreviations SE, RU, RF, US, FE/BE, APP SEG, APP SEVV are listed.
Steps.Expected Result: All specified abbreviations are present in the section.

test_cases.Preconditions: User has the application installed and is on the Definitions and Abbreviations page.
test_cases.Expected Result: The list of definitions and abbreviations is displayed as specified.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers only display of definitions and abbreviations; no interaction functionality tested.

test_cases.Title: Definitions_and_Abbreviations_Navigation_002_App_TEST_Mobile

Steps.Step Description: Navigate through the application to access the Definitions and Abbreviations section.
Steps.Expected Result: User is successfully taken to the Definitions and Abbreviations section.

Steps.Step Description: Verify the navigation UI elements such as back button and section header.
Steps.Expected Result: The back button and the section header are displayed and usable.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged into the application.
test_cases.Expected Result: Navigation is seamless and all UI elements function as expected.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers basic navigation; does not include validation of input functionality.

test_cases.Title: Abbreviations_Description_003_App_TEST_Web

Steps.Step Description: Access the web application and find the Definitions and Abbreviations section.
Steps.Expected Result: The Definitions and Abbreviations section is correctly displayed on the web page.

Steps.Step Description: Check if clicking on each abbreviation reveals a pop-up description.
Steps.Expected Result: A pop-up description is displayed for each abbreviation when clicked.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is on the Definitions and Abbreviations page of the web application.
test_cases.Expected Result: All abbreviations are clickable, and their descriptions are displayed correctly.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Covers clicking descriptions; user input is not verified.

test_cases.Title: CheckIn_Functionality_001_Mobile_TEST_Smartphone

Steps.Step Description: Launch the mobile application.
Steps.Expected Result: The application opens to the home screen.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'Check-In' section.
Steps.Expected Result: The Check-In screen is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select a date and time for check-in.
Steps.Expected Result: The selected date and time are displayed correctly.

Steps.Step Description: Confirm the check-in by clicking on the 'Confirm' button.
Steps.Expected Result: A confirmation message is shown, indicating successful check-in.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged into the application.
test_cases.Dataset: Valid date and time for check-in.
test_cases.Expected Result: User successfully checks in, and confirmation is displayed.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Only checks for basic check-in functionality; does not validate additional options.

test_cases.Title: CheckIn_ErrorHandling_002_Mobile_TEST_Smartphone

Steps.Step Description: Launch the mobile application and navigate to 'Check-In'.
Steps.Expected Result: The Check-In screen is displayed.

Steps.Step Description: Select an invalid date (past date).
Steps.Expected Result: An error message is displayed, indicating invalid date selection.

Steps.Step Description: Try to confirm check-in with invalid date.
Steps.Expected Result: The confirmation button is disabled, preventing check-in.

test_cases.Preconditions: User is logged into the application.
test_cases.Expected Result: Error handling for invalid check-in date is successfully validated.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Focuses on error handling but does not cover valid check-in scenarios.

test_cases.Title: AI_Angel_Numera_Functionality_001_Web_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Open the GNTN Game Client application.
Steps.Expected Result: The main interface of the GNTN Game Client is displayed correctly.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'AI Angel Numera' functionality section.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'AI Angel Numera' option is visible and selectable.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'AI Angel Numera' option and click on it.
Steps.Expected Result: The AI Angel Numera interface is displayed, allowing the creation of a combination.

Steps.Step Description: Input parameters to generate the lottery combination.
Steps.Expected Result: Inputs are accepted without any errors.

Steps.Step Description: Click the 'Generate' button.
Steps.Expected Result: The generated combination is displayed as per input parameters.

test_cases.Preconditions: User must be logged into the GNTN Game Client.
test_cases.Dataset: Various player selection parameters for lottery generation.
test_cases.Expected Result: AI Angel Numera successfully generates a lottery combination.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Only covers the combination generation functionality; user experience not evaluated.

test_cases.Title: AI_Angel_Numera_ErrorHandling_002_Web_TEST_Desktop

Steps.Step Description: Open the GNTN Game Client application.
Steps.Expected Result: The main interface of the GNTN Game Client is displayed correctly.

Steps.Step Description: Navigate to the 'AI Angel Numera' functionality section.
Steps.Expected Result: The 'AI Angel Numera' option is visible and selectable.

Steps.Step Description: Select the 'AI Angel Numera' option and click on it.
Steps.Expected Result: The AI Angel Numera interface is displayed, allowing the creation of a combination.

Steps.Step Description: Input invalid parameters to generate the lottery combination.
Steps.Expected Result: An error message appears indicating the parameters are invalid.

test_cases.Preconditions: User must be logged into the GNTN Game Client.
test_cases.Expected Result: AI Angel Numera displays an appropriate error message for invalid input parameters.
test_cases.Partial Coverage Description: Only covers the error handling aspect; flow leading to combination generation not tested.
